reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars 20 storage bags for under $1 per unit
reviews.reviewText: While it's an inexpensive item per unit and has potential, it has taken me a while to wrap my head around how to use these best. My habit is to scour for boxes to organize household items, so I've been pondering what these might do. So far, I've used three: one for surplus charging cables, another for product manuals, and a third for household fasteners.The bags themselves are reasonably constructed. The zipper section is the weakest link; perhaps it is best to avoid storing items that require daily access. The mesh lattice on the sides obscures the visibility, but with ordinary room lighting, it's possible to see what's inside. They come in two sizes, 10 of each.Contrary to the assertion on the product page, they are not waterproof. While the lower plastic section repels moisture, the zipper area is porous, and in my test, the inside filled with water in seconds. While you won't rely on them when canoeing, there's still an extensive range of land-based applications for these, as other reviewers have pointed out.I'm slowly figuring out what they can do, but I'm pleased to have a new storage option. While I often use gallon-size Ziplock bags for kitchen food storage, these are much more versatile for household use. Soon, I will test them as a repository for household batteries, spare cleaning cloths, and computer parts. It doesn't hurt to have an extra storage option handy.

reviews.reviewerName: Just a random guyJust a random guy
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Tough and Veraatile
reviews.reviewText: First Impressions of Mesh Zipper Pouch Bags,Waterproof Zipper Bags,20pcs Document File Folders,for Puzzle Board Game Storage,for School Office Supplies.This (20) pack of tough zippered bags have more uses than I originally planned for them. I tried to tear one apart and could not with about 70% of my strength – I’m not the strongest man but I am 240 lbs and over 6 feet and I’m no elf. These bags are see-thru-ish – contents are semi-visible through the fabric. The mesh reinforced material and construction makes this bag water-resistant – but the zippers are not waterproof, so no dunking allowed. When I read mesh, I think screen door - but this material is solid and does not breathe - it is a mesh reinforced material.For a lost-cost bag, the zippers seem stronger than I would expect and also zip open and close smoothly. These bags are much bigger than I thought them to be. I easily fit magazines in the “smaller” of the two bags, and the larger bag could fit a pair of my pants (I’m XXL - 40/32 pants) and could be used as a packing cube for traveling in a pinch.I think this is a 5-star product because I’ve seen ones that cost more (and possibly less, so shop before buying) but even so, the unit price of each bag in this order is a good bit less than a dollar per unit ($0.85/ea) for a very useful organization product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Heaven-Sent Solution for Bible Study Organization
reviews.reviewText: The Mesh Zipper Pouch Bags have proven to be an excellent option for my Bible study organizational needs. With 20 waterproof zipper bags in a pack, these pouches have been an invaluable tool for organizing my extensive collection of study guides and supplies.Finding particular materials is made simple by the mesh design, which also adds a touch of aesthetic appeal and makes the contents easily visible. The waterproof function protects my essential study materials from unexpected accidents.Using these pouches has greatly helped my time management skills during Bible study sessions. I can now easily find the materials I need without having to go through a disorganized stack of papers. The simplicity of having a pouch for each topic or study guide has added a new level of organization and efficiency to my study practice.These Mesh Zipper Pouch Bags are a true blessing, whether you're a student, professional, or, as I am, a Bible study enthusiast. They provide a practical solution for organizing and securing your materials, allowing you to study more effectively and productively.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Quality... Versatile and Useful for Organizing So Many Things
reviews.reviewText: These mesh zipper pouch bags are awesome. The variety of uses for these are endless. I am primarily using these for craft and homeschool supplies. I also use a few for blocks, kid’s puzzles, and board games. The are space saving compared to boxes and still offer protection. They are sturdy with good zippers. So many kid items that I buy either don’t fit back in the box after being taken out so these are a great solution for that. Use these for painting supplies, camping, travel, board games, blocks, puzzles, cleaning brushes/sponges, toys with little pieces, office supplies, ribbons, accessories, papers, homeschool materials, and s much more! The zippers all work smoothly and seem relatively well-made. You get so many large bags I this set making it a great value. One of my favorite things about these bags is that they are semi-see through so that you can see what is inside without opening them up or needing labels.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I was this day’s old when I learned such zipper pouches existed. To date, I’ve been using ziploc type bags for storing all those annoying things we need or should keep; but have so much trouble keeping organized and where they will fit with ease.Enter these mesh zipper pouch bags: 10 large and 10 medium large, all with different color bands to stay even more organized while you are organizing. I will be able to load so much from the infamous family junk drawer as well as from all my ziploc bags:Portable chargers. USB lightning cords. USB C cords. Outdoor solar lighting charging accessories. Security charging accessories. Sharpie markers. Binder clips. Loose piles of post it notes. A pouch for mailing letters: stamps, address stamp, address labels, bill paying envelopes. Business cards for service workers.I think you get the point? 🤪☺️😉These are very useful for organizing what you THOUGHT you had organized. How naive we are lollll.

reviews.reviewText: I love these, they are great for storing important documents. They are bigger than I realized, was hoping to use them for pens and markers. Very sturdy.
